headline: How Does Your Strategy Stack Up Against 2026 Market Reality?
subheadline: Take this 8-question audit to see where you stand and what to fix first.
emailGateSubtitle: Enter your email to see your score and action plan

questions.question: 1. How do you currently measure email performance?

options.title: Currently not measuring
options.desc: Not tracking performance metrics, triggers, or events

options.title: Open rates (primary metric)
options.desc: This is our main KPI

options.title: Clicks & conversions
options.desc: Shifted away from opens as primary

options.title: Revenue & lifetime value (LTV) per send
options.desc: Tracking full-funnel impact

strength.title: Email Metrics
strength.desc: You are measuring revenue impact not vanity metrics.

gapIfNotChosen.title: Email Metrics Gap
gapIfNotChosen.desc: Open rates became less reliable after privacy changes. Strong teams prioritize clicks conversions and revenue per send.
gapIfNotChosen.trend: Deliverability is increasingly tied to engagement quality not vanity metrics.

questions.question: 2. How personalized is your email program?

options.title: Generic sends (minimal segmentation)
options.desc: Same email to most subscribers

options.title: Basic segmentation (3–5 groups)
options.desc: Segment by role company size or past purchase

options.title: Behavioral personalization + automated sequences
options.desc: Recency engagement depth LTV dynamic content and automated journeys

strength.title: Behavioral Personalization
strength.desc: Behavioral personalization plus automated sequences puts you near the top tier.

gapIfNotChosen.title: Personalization Gap
gapIfNotChosen.desc: Basic segmentation helps but behavior-based personalization + automated sequences is the new baseline for relevance.
gapIfNotChosen.trend: Expectations have shifted toward lifecycle automation and engagement-based segmentation.

questions.question: 3. When someone hits your site (paid or organic) do you capture intent and follow up if they don't book?

options.title: Currently have no tracking system
options.desc: May or may not have an email opt-in, but not using it

options.title: We mostly lose them
options.desc: We get traffic but have limited tracking/capture and no consistent follow-up

options.title: We capture some intent + do manual follow-up
options.desc: Basic tracking + forms; follow-up happens but it's inconsistent

options.title: We capture intent + run automated follow-up sequences
options.desc: Behavior events (pricing case study demo page) trigger email/retargeting follow-ups for non-bookers

strength.title: Intent Capture + Follow-Up
strength.desc: You capture site intent and trigger follow-ups for non-bookers.

gapIfNotChosen.title: Website Intent Capture Gap
gapIfNotChosen.desc: If traffic lands and leaves with no capture you are paying for attention without building a follow-up asset.
gapIfNotChosen.trend: First-party data + intent signals are becoming the core advantage for personalization and timing.

questions.question: 4. How do you keep interested leads from slipping through the cracks?

options.title: Adhoc
options.desc: Manual reminders and memory-based follow-up

options.title: Documented but not automated
options.desc: We know the steps but execution is inconsistent

options.title: Automated follow-up triggers
options.desc: Behavior triggers sequences (e.g. pricing view → follow-up; demo no-show → reschedule sequence)

strength.title: Follow-Up Triggers
strength.desc: You use triggers so interested leads get a timely next step.

gapIfNotChosen.title: Lead Follow-Up Gap
gapIfNotChosen.desc: Manual follow-up leads to inconsistent execution missed timing and lost opportunities.
gapIfNotChosen.trend: Behavior-triggered follow-up systems reduce leakage and improve conversion rates.

options.title: We have behavior-based segmentation and track of all of our communications with our clients, customers, and prospects alongside regular touchpoints

strength.title: Follow-Up Triggers
strength.desc: You use triggers so interested leads get a timely next step.

gapIfNotChosen.title: Lead Follow-Up Gap
gapIfNotChosen.desc: Manual follow-up leads to inconsistent execution missed timing and lost opportunities.
gapIfNotChosen.trend: Behavior-triggered follow-up systems reduce leakage and improve conversion rates.

questions.question: 5. Is your revenue mostly from new or existing clients / customers?

options.title: Not sure
options.desc: Do not have a system or not actively tracking

options.title: 80%+ new 20% or less existing
options.desc: New customers are the main source of revenue

options.title: 50/50 split
options.desc: Both generate an equal amount of revenue

options.title: 60%+ existing 40% new
options.desc: Customer lifetime value (LTV) and expansion are the growth engine

strength.title: LTV-First Strategy
strength.desc: You treat retention and expansion as core growth.

gapIfNotChosen.title: LTV & Retention Gap
gapIfNotChosen.desc: Teams that over-prioritize acquisition often miss compounding growth from retention and expansion.
gapIfNotChosen.trend: Retention and expansion are increasingly treated as primary growth levers.

questions.question: 6. Do you have an owned distribution channel (newsletter community audience)?

options.title: No
options.desc: Rely on paid reach + outbound

options.title: Starting one
options.desc: Early newsletter early audience building

options.title: Strong owned channel
options.desc: Consistent audience that drives pipeline

strength.title: Owned Distribution
strength.desc: You control a compounding asset that reliably reaches your market.

gapIfNotChosen.title: Owned Distribution Gap
gapIfNotChosen.desc: Without an owned channel you depend on paid reach and outbound effort for attention.
gapIfNotChosen.trend: Owned audiences reduce CAC and create compounding distribution.

questions.question: 7. How do you distribute content and reach prospects?

options.title: Isolated tactics
options.desc: Email OR ads OR LinkedIn; focused on individual channel strategies

options.title: Coordinated across 2–3 channels
options.desc: Some synergy but not fully integrated

options.title: Ecosystem strategy (owned + earned + paid)
options.desc: Channels feed each other (content → email → retargeting → conversion)

strength.title: Ecosystem Distribution
strength.desc: Owned + earned + paid channels are aligned.

gapIfNotChosen.title: Distribution & Ecosystem Gap
gapIfNotChosen.desc: Isolated channels underperform integrated ecosystems where channels feed each other.
gapIfNotChosen.trend: Community and owned distribution increasingly compete with paid reach.

questions.question: 8. How do you build credibility with cold/warm prospects?

options.title: Product-first
options.desc: Lead with services, features, benefits, and / or pricing

options.title: Proof-driven
options.desc: Utilize case studies, results, testimonials to demonstrate expertise and build credibility

options.title: Trust-first, brand-focused
options.desc: Lead with insights and brand awareness, building trust through credibility and growing brand presence

options.title: Customer-focused, consistent visible thought leadership, case studies, and education
options.desc: Established founder and / or executive presence, regularly share education, case studies, and resources based on insights and feedback loops

strength.title: Customer-First, Trust-Focused Positioning
strength.desc: You're customer focused and insight-driven, regularly building and maintaining relationships with new & existing clients / customers to consistently provide valuable education, resources, and thought leadership.

gapIfNotChosen.title: Positioning Gap
gapIfNotChosen.desc: Leading with product details can underperform leading with education, insights, and thought leadership based on the current landscape and regular feedback loops.
gapIfNotChosen.trend: Trust is increasingly built through building relationships with new and existing clients / customers or prospects, visible founder or executive presence, providing value and education, proof of expertise, and credible distribution with an obvious focus and clear understanding of the customer.

actions.title: Shift email KPIs to clicks conversions and revenue-per-send
actions.desc: Keep opens as directional only. Optimize segmentation and offers around outcomes.

actions.title: Add behavioral segmentation + automated email sequences
actions.desc: Build flows for active at-risk and dormant segments; trigger sequences from clicks visits and key events.

actions.title: Capture website intent and follow up with non-bookers
actions.desc: Track key events (pricing demo case studies). Trigger email (and optional retargeting) for visitors who did not book.

actions.title: Build a simple follow-up trigger system
actions.desc: Create rules for no-shows abandoned booking pages pricing views and clicked but didn't book outcomes.

actions.title: Rebalance toward retention and expansion
actions.desc: Formalize onboarding adoption nudges renewal sequences and expansion offers.

actions.title: Start or strengthen an owned channel
actions.desc: Newsletter or community that compounds attention and reduces paid dependency.

scoreTiers.title: Your strategy is strong
scoreTiers.subtitle: You're ahead of most. Focus on compounding your advantages.

scoreTiers.title: Moderate Alignment
scoreTiers.subtitle: You have a solid foundation. Closing a few gaps could unlock growth.

scoreTiers.title: You're missing out
scoreTiers.subtitle: There is untapped leverage and strategic shifts that could materially improve your results.
